meanings.definition: A rapid succession of loud, sharp sounds.
meanings.sent1: The rataplans of the fireworks filled the night sky.
meanings.sent2: The rataplans of the drum echoed through the room.
meanings.sent3: The rataplans of the pots and pans clashing together made a funny rhythm.
meanings.sent4: The rataplans of the hail on the roof sounded like a tiny army marching.
meanings.sent5: The rataplans of the woodpecker on the tree trunk were unmistakable.

meanings.definition: To make a rapid succession of loud, sharp sounds.
meanings.sent1: She rataplans on the table with her drumsticks, creating a lively beat.
meanings.sent2: The hail rataplans on the window, creating a rhythmic melody.
meanings.sent3: The children rataplans on their desks to mimic the sound of rain.
meanings.sent4: The fireworks rataplans in the distance, signaling the start of the celebration.
meanings.sent5: The woodpecker rataplans on the tree, searching for insects to eat.
